Class TextCompare

  • java.lang.Object
    • TextCompare

  • public class TextCompare
extends java.lang.Object
    TextCompare class manages TextCompare objects which hold the vectors of Word and DictionaryWord objects
    Author:
    Heidi Mitre and Karen Shemer

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.Vector<DictionaryWord> dictionaryWordVector 
      java.util.Vector<Word> wordCompareVector
      TextCompare objects have two attributes: 1) a wordCompareVector which contains the Word objects read in from a text file 2) a dictionaryWordVector which contains the DictionaryWord objects read in from a dictionary file

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TextCompare()
      The TextCompare constructor creates a new TextCompare object with empty wordCompareVector and dictionaryWordVector

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addWordToDictionary(Word addThis)
      The addWordToDictionary method adds a word to the dictionaryWordVector as visible
      java.util.Vector<Word> compareText(java.lang.String textFile, java.lang.String dictionaryFile)
      The compare Text method calls the readFile method to read a text file and calls the readDictionary method to read a dictionary file.
      boolean ignoreWord(Word ignoreThis)
      The ignoreWord method adds a word to the dictionaryWordVector as ignored
      boolean inDictionary(java.lang.String checkWord)
      The inDictionary method searches each DictionaryWord in dictionaryWordVector to determine if there is already a DictionaryWord object for the given string
      boolean isDuplicate(java.lang.String checkWord)
      The isDuplicate method searches each Word in wordCompareVector to determine if there is already a Word object for the given string
      boolean isInDictionary(java.lang.String checkWord)
      The isInDictionary method searches each Word in dictionaryWordVector to determine if there is already a DictionaryWord object for the given string
      void markAsFound(java.lang.String dictionaryWord)
      The markAsFound method sets isInDictionary to true for all Word objects in wordCompareVector if the Word is found in the dictionary file.
      void printDictionaryWords()
      The printDictionaryWords method is used for testing and prints all DictionaryWord objects in the dictionaryWordVector.
      void printWords()
      The printWords method is used for testing and prints all Word objects in the wordCompareVector.
      void readDictionary(java.lang.String fileName)
      The readDictionary method reads the dictionary file and adds a new DictionaryWord object for each dictionary word to the dictionaryWordVector.
      int[] readFile(java.lang.String fileName)
      The readFile method reads the text file and adds a new Word object for each word to the wordCompareVector.
      boolean replaceWord(Word original, java.lang.String replacement)
      The replaceWord method changes the text field of a given word, so long as the word is not already in the dictionary
      void updateFile(java.lang.String fileName, java.lang.String original, java.lang.String replacement)
      The updateFile method creates an updated string to write to a text file when a word has been replaced
      java.lang.String writeDictionary(java.lang.String fileName)
      The writeDictionary method creates a dictionary file and writes to it all the String text of each visible DictionaryWord within the dictionaryWordVector.
      void writeStatistics(java.lang.String fileName, int numWordsRead, int numReplaced, int numAdded, int numLinesRead, int numIgnored)
      The writeStatistics method creates a statistics file and writes to it statistics for the input file

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • wordCompareVector

        public java.util.Vector<Word> wordCompareVector
        TextCompare objects have two attributes: 1) a wordCompareVector which contains the Word objects read in from a text file 2) a dictionaryWordVector which contains the DictionaryWord objects read in from a dictionary file

      • dictionaryWordVector

        public java.util.Vector<DictionaryWord> dictionaryWordVector

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextCompare

        public TextCompare()
        The TextCompare constructor creates a new TextCompare object with empty wordCompareVector and dictionaryWordVector

    • Method Detail

      • compareText

        public java.util.Vector<Word> compareText(java.lang.String textFile,
                                          java.lang.String dictionaryFile)
        The compare Text method calls the readFile method to read a text file and calls the readDictionary method to read a dictionary file.
        Parameters:
        textFile - the name of the text file to be read
        dictionaryFile - the name of the dictionary file to be read
        Returns:
        the vector containing all Word objects read from the text file

      • readFile

        public int[] readFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        The readFile method reads the text file and adds a new Word object for each word to the wordCompareVector. The readFile method checks for duplicate words by calling the isDuplicate method.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the text file to read
        Returns:
        an array of integers containing the word and line count

      • isDuplicate

        public boolean isDuplicate(java.lang.String checkWord)
        The isDuplicate method searches each Word in wordCompareVector to determine if there is already a Word object for the given string
        Parameters:
        checkWord - is the String that will be searched in wordCompareVector
        Returns:
        a boolean that indicates if word is a duplicate

      • isInDictionary

        public boolean isInDictionary(java.lang.String checkWord)
        The isInDictionary method searches each Word in dictionaryWordVector to determine if there is already a DictionaryWord object for the given string
        Parameters:
        checkWord - is the String that will be searched in dictionaryWordVector
        Returns:
        a boolean that indicates if word is a duplicate

      • readDictionary

        public void readDictionary(java.lang.String fileName)
        The readDictionary method reads the dictionary file and adds a new DictionaryWord object for each dictionary word to the dictionaryWordVector. The readDictionary method also calls the markAsFound method.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the dictionary file to read

      • markAsFound

        public void markAsFound(java.lang.String dictionaryWord)
        The markAsFound method sets isInDictionary to true for all Word objects in wordCompareVector if the Word is found in the dictionary file.
        Parameters:
        dictionaryWord - the word read from the dictionary

      • inDictionary

        public boolean inDictionary(java.lang.String checkWord)
        The inDictionary method searches each DictionaryWord in dictionaryWordVector to determine if there is already a DictionaryWord object for the given string
        Parameters:
        checkWord - is the String that will be searched in dictionaryWordVector
        Returns:
        a boolean that indicates if word is a duplicate

      • printWords

        public void printWords()
        The printWords method is used for testing and prints all Word objects in the wordCompareVector.

      • printDictionaryWords

        public void printDictionaryWords()
        The printDictionaryWords method is used for testing and prints all DictionaryWord objects in the dictionaryWordVector.

      • addWordToDictionary

        public boolean addWordToDictionary(Word addThis)
        The addWordToDictionary method adds a word to the dictionaryWordVector as visible
        Parameters:
        addThis - is the Word being added as visible
        Returns:
        a boolean that indicates if word was added to dictionary

      • ignoreWord

        public boolean ignoreWord(Word ignoreThis)
        The ignoreWord method adds a word to the dictionaryWordVector as ignored
        Parameters:
        ignoreThis - is the Word being added as ignored
        Returns:
        a boolean that indicates if word was ignored

      • replaceWord

        public boolean replaceWord(Word original,
                           java.lang.String replacement)
        The replaceWord method changes the text field of a given word, so long as the word is not already in the dictionary
        Parameters:
        original - is the Word being edited, and replacement is the new String
        Returns:
        a boolean that indicates if word was replaced

      • updateFile

        public void updateFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                       java.lang.String original,
                       java.lang.String replacement)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        The updateFile method creates an updated string to write to a text file when a word has been replaced
        Parameters:
        fileName - to overwrite, original word and replacement word
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • writeDictionary

        public java.lang.String writeDictionary(java.lang.String fileName)
        The writeDictionary method creates a dictionary file and writes to it all the String text of each visible DictionaryWord within the dictionaryWordVector.
        Returns:
        a string to indicate to user if dictionary was written to file

      • writeStatistics

        public void writeStatistics(java.lang.String fileName,
                            int numWordsRead,
                            int numReplaced,
                            int numAdded,
                            int numLinesRead,
                            int numIgnored)
        The writeStatistics method creates a statistics file and writes to it statistics for the input file
        Parameters:
        fileName - of input text file, int statistics to be written to file
